Package org.ejml.alg.dense.decomposition

Interface Summary
CholeskyDecomposition A Cholesky Decomposition is a special decomposition for positive-definite symmetric matrices that is more efficient than other general purposes decomposition.
DecompositionInterface A decomposition is a way in which a matrix is broken up into multiple matrices.
EigenDecomposition This is a generic interface for computing the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a matrix.
LUDecomposition LU Decomposition refactors the original matrix such that:
PT*L*U = A
where P is a pivot matrix, L is a lower triangular matrix, U is an upper triangular matrix and A is the original matrix.
QRDecomposition QR decompositions decompose a rectangular matrix 'A' such that 'A=QR'.
SingularValueDecomposition This is an abstract class for singular value decomposition (SVD) algorithms.
 

Class Summary
DecompositionFactory Selecting which specific implementation of a decomposition to use can be difficult unless one has an intiment understanding of each of them works.
MatrixInvertSpecialized This class is for hardcoded analytical matrix inversion algorithms.
TriangularSolver This contains algorithms for solving systems of equations where T is a non-singular triangular matrix:

T*x = b

where x and b are vectors, and T is an n by n matrix.
 

Exception Summary
SingularMatrixException This exception is thrown if an operation can not be finished because the matrix is singular.
